metadata.title: CVE-2019-10224 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
A flaw has been found in 389-ds-base versions 1.4.x.x before 1.4.1.3. When executed in verbose mode, the dscreate and dsconf commands may display sensitive information, such as the Directory Manager password. An attacker, able to see the screen or record the terminal standard error output, could use this flaw to gain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-10224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.1.5-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.1.5-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.1.5-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.1.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.1.5-1').
